results.title: History of Python - Wikipedia
results.snippet: The programming language Python was conceived in the late 1980s, [1] and its implementation was started in December 1989 [2] by Guido van Rossum at CWI in the Netherlands as a successor to ABC capable of exception handling and interfacing with the Amoeba operating system. [3]

results.title: Python | Definition, Language, History, & Facts | Britannica
results.snippet: Nov 27, 2025 · Dutch programmer Guido van Rossum developed Python in 1991 after expressing frustration with the limitations of the programming language ABC. Python , which he named after the British television series Monty Python ’s Flying Circus, was publicly released in 1994.
